intro: Acinodendron pseudocentrophorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
